TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ReportServerCredentials extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.IReportServerCredentials

Docs.summary: Specifies the credentials for the ReportViewer control to use when connecting to a report server.
Docs.remarks:
<!CDATA[
## Remarks By default, the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportViewer> control uses the default Windows identity to connect to the report server. The ReportServerCredentials class is implemented as a property of the <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ReportViewer> control and can be used to provide custom authentication for connecting to the report server.
]>

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetFormsCredentials (out System.Net.Cookie authCookie, out string userName, out string password, out string authority);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool GetFormsCredentials(class System.Net.Cookie authCookie, string userName, string password, string authority) cil managed

Docs.summary: Specifies the user to impersonate when connecting to the report server.
Docs.remarks:
<!CDATA[
## Remarks The ReportViewer control will to attempt to connect to the report server as the current thread user if this property is not set.
]>

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the network credentials used for authentication with the report server.
Docs.remarks:
<!CDATA[  
  
## Examples  
  
```c#  
using System;  
using System.Collections.Generic;  
using System.ComponentModel;  
using System.Data;  
using System.Drawing;  
using System.Text;  
using System.Windows.Forms;  
using System.Net;  
  
namespace ReportServerCredentialsSample  
{  
    public partial class Form1 : Form  
    {  
        public Form1()  
        {  
            InitializeComponent();  
        }  
  
        private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)  
        {  
            reportViewer1.ProcessingMode =  
                Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ProcessingMode.Remote;  
  
            reportViewer1.ServerReport.ReportPath =   
                @"/Adventureworks Sample Reports/Company Sales";  
  
            NetworkCredential myCred = new   
                NetworkCredential(<UserName>, <Password>, <DomainName>);  
            reportViewer1.ServerReport.ReportServerCredentials.NetworkCredentials =  
                myCred;  
  
            reportViewer1.RefreshReport();  
        }  
    }  
}  
```  
  
 ]>

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetFormsCredentials (System.Net.Cookie authCookie, string userName, string password, string authority);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetFormsCredentials(class System.Net.Cookie authCookie, string userName, string password, string authority) cil managed

Docs.summary: Specifies that forms authentication is to be used when connecting to the report server and provides the forms credentials.
Docs.remarks:
<!CDATA[  
  
## Examples  
  
```c#  
using System;  
using System.Collections.Generic;  
using System.ComponentModel;  
using System.Data;  
using System.Drawing;  
using System.Text;  
using System.Windows.Forms;  
using System.Net;  
  
namespace ReportServerCredentialsSample  
{  
    public partial class Form1 : Form  
    {  
        public Form1()  
        {  
            InitializeComponent();  
        }  
  
        private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)  
        {  
            reportViewer1.ProcessingMode = Microsoft.Reporting.WinForms.ProcessingMode.Remote;  
  
            reportViewer1.ServerReport.ReportPath =   
                @"/Adventureworks Sample Reports/Company Sales";  
  
            reportViewer1.ServerReport.ReportServerCredentials.SetFormsCredentials(  
                null, <UserName>, <Password>, <DomainName>);  
  
            reportViewer1.RefreshReport();  
        }  
    }  
}  
```  
  
 ]>
